H0.text: Heat is generated and conserved by mammals through a high metabolic rate and hair.

H1.text: Resources are generated and conserved by mammals through a high metabolic rate and hair.

H2.text: Energy is generated and conserved by high metabolic rate and hair in mammals.

H3.text: Water is what mammals generate and conserve through a high metabolic rate and hair.

A4.text: Using small smooth muscles (arrector pili in mammals), which are attached to feather or hair shafts; this distorts the surface of the skin making feather/hair shaft stand erect (called goose bumps or goose pimples) which slows the movement of air across the skin and minimizes heat loss.

A5.text: Most body heat is generated in the deep organs, especially the liver, brain, and heart, and in contraction of skeletal muscles.
